verses.roman:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
ity abhipretya manasā
hy āvantyo dvija-sattamaḥ
unmucya hṛdaya-granthīn
śānto bhikṣur abhūn muniḥ

synonyms: śrī-bhagavān uvāca—the Supreme Lord said; iti—thus; abhipretya—concluding; manasā—within his mind; hi—indeed; āvantyaḥ—of the district of Avantī; dvija-sat-tamaḥ—now the most pious brāhmaṇa; unmucya—untying; hṛdaya—in his heart; granthīn—the knots (of desire); śāntaḥ—peaceful; bhikṣuḥ—a mendicant sannyāsī; abhūt—he became; muniḥ—silent.
translation: Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa continued: His mind thus determined, that most excellent Avantī brāhmaṇa was able to untie the knots of desire within his heart. He then assumed the role of a peaceful and silent sannyāsī mendicant.
